definition.value: to be seen; to be visible; to be in sight​

example.value: 聖霊がある方の上に下って、その上にとどまられるのが見えたなら、その方こそ聖霊によってバプテスマを授ける方である。
example.translation: The man on whom you see the Spirit come down and remain is he who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.

definition.value: to look; to seem; to appear​

example.value: １１ページの地図はとても奇妙に見える。逆さまにしてみると、見慣れた地図になる。
example.translation: The map on page 11 looks very strange. Turn it upside down. Then it becomes a familiar map to you.

definition.value: 〘hum〙 to have an audience; to meet; to see.​

example.value: 彼女はきれいな目をしている。
ヘレン・ケラーは目と耳と口が不自由だった。
example.translation: Helen Keller was blind, deaf and mute.

example.value: 彼は崇拝の眼で彼女を眺めた。
example.translation: He regarded her with worship in his eyes.

definition.value: notice; attention; observation; eyes (of the world, public, etc.)​
discrimination; discernment; judgement; eye (e.g. for quality)​
chance (of success); possibility (of a good result)​
spacing (between crossed strands of a net, mesh, etc.); opening; stitch; texture; weave
intersection (on a go board); square (on a chessboard)​
dot (on a dice); pip; rolled number​
